column4: could you please offer some help? sorry to single you out but I am frustrated :S
that does not make me an expert on what you are trying to do, whatever that may be :P
well, see if you know, basically 1 sec I will image shack a printscreen of my desktop
you see how the height of the main panel is nearly double that of the bottom? and the icons and menu buttons are sitting on a different color than the panel color?
and the icons are massive with ugly dark lines seperating them?
this is what I am trying to change
I also have no system icons anymore apart from "sound"
http://imageshack.us/f/839/screenshotat20111015115.png/ <--- that displays my problem a little better..
tbh I don't know, I installed 11.10.. booted and didnt like the new layout of gnome.. so I installed gnome classic logged out and logged back in
what have I done wrong? so i need to isntall something totally different?
try to use a different theme and relog
canonical replaced the classic gnome2 desktop with unity, and you're  probably running gnome3 in the fallback mode
what do you mean? changing the theme doesnt change the height of the top panel
so, *you* did nothing wrong, they just didnt tell you that the upgrade would mess up the way your desktop used to work :P
so how do you use your desktop? do you use the new gnome layout?
sroecker: let's try to fix that in a seperate channel or something #oneiricgnomepanel
